pull.title: Use bit ops instead of int mult for constant-time logic in gej_add_ge
pull.body: Nothing is wrong with the current implementation. But it looks out of place because we generally prefer bit operations because they're faster and are more likely constant-time.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.message: Use bit ops instead of int mult for constant-time logic in gej_add_ge

comments.body: I can't show you any evidence right but from my experience `!` is much more likely to make compilers introduce branches.

@elichai Compilers don't translate every C operator the same way. We know the current code works (valgrind ctime test) with common compilers on common platforms, but that's no guarantee for the future, or a guarantee that a `~` is never compiled into a branch in other contexts.

There is no downside to using `~`, right?
I guess you're right. And I believe @real-or-random when he says that `!` is more likely to introduce branches :)
Good remark that we use `!` other places, I wasn't really aware of this anymore. But ok, I'd say let's keep it then.
